1604065449_mirrored_obv-mikhail_github.body:
I see, here they write that the problems with the iframe have been around for a long time. But I have worked in ZeroBlogs YouTube through the iframe for a long time and well. I left a lot of blogs posts with YouTube video inserts. But recently they all stopped working :-/

```
Reason: CORS header 'Access-Control-Allow-Origin' missing
```

Is it possible to think of something to make YouTube videos work again on ZeroBlogs?

The most common thing is that earlier in ZeroBlog worked perfectly iframe-inserts on YouTube-video. I read reviews that iframe in ZeroNet and should not work, but I used such videos in blogs dozens of times and everything worked fine. But recently it stopped working. Apparently, YouTube has increased security requirements. And now they require a header:

```
Uncaught DOMException: Failed to read the 'cookie' property from 'Document': The document is sandboxed and lacks the 'allow-same-origin' flag.
```
Can not this be fixed in ZeroNet itself? :)

Here are examples of videos that worked fine before, but stopped working now:

http://127.0.0.1:43110/144W6itCd6jUqHDx5SDjbFaRdTnh4gRBBA/?Post:41:60+years+of+space+age

http://127.0.0.1:43110/1ApsfuUfnyJm19qZguDzzqj7se41Ggxzrt/?Post:2:Имитатор+огня+из+светодиодной+ленты...

1604066471_mirrored_thisguy43110_github.body: The same bug when checking files in `ZeroUp`. The Windows version of ZeroNet. **rev3412**.

1604066807_mirrored_DaniellMesquita_gith.body:
> Only who posted the video can manually seed it, by signing its content.json file

https://github.com/HelloZeroNet/ZeroNet/issues/1617#issuecomment-421758128

Often nothing helps. I don't know how to fight it. If I put my file with the same name manually and try to publish it, it even on the machine where the publication was, trying to download the file from the network (where it is not), and not to distribute my local file.

> There is a Check files option at the site on ZeroHello. 

I know this option. It allows you to download newly corrupted files. But it does not allow you to connect to the distribution of the correct file, if ZeroNet believes that this file has not been downloaded. I don't know how ZeroNet thinks the file is already downloaded and how It isn't, but to fix this error, you have to repeatedly republish the file from different computers under different names :)

1604066858_mirrored_DaniellMesquita_gith.body: Unfortunately, it's kind of a long-standing problem bigfiles in ZeroNet. It often happens that if a single source is added to a large file, but there is some failure, then this file is not distributed in any way. ZeroNet, instead of just handing out the file from the disk, tries to download it from the network where it doesn't exist. I do siteSign (from cli), sign files, hash them — but ZeroNet is constantly looking for files on the network and does not distribute the one that placed in the data folder.
